results.title: BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 76-year-old man with @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ stage 3, essential @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, and receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ presented to the Emergency Department with @DISEASE_Lethargy @DISEASE_MESH:D053609 @@@lethargy@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@weakness@@@ that started 3 days ago, with rapid deterioration into @DISEASE_Shock @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@.

citations.NLM: Bailuni Neto JJ, Siqueira BL, Machado FC, Boros GAB, Akamine MAV, Cordeiro de Paula LJ, Rodrigues de Assis AC, Soares PR, Scudeler TL. BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report Am J Case Rep. 2022 Jan 21;23():e934600. PMID: 35058422
citations.BibTeX: @article{35058422, title={BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report}, author={Bailuni Neto JJ and Siqueira BL and Machado FC and Boros GAB and Akamine MAV and Cordeiro de Paula LJ and Rodrigues de Assis AC and Soares PR and Scudeler TL}, journal={Am J Case Rep}, volume={23}, pages={e934600}}

results.title: Paralysis that easily reverses: a case of thyrotoxic periodic paralysis.
results.text_hl: Here we present the case of a 25-year-old man who presented to the emergency department (ED) with sudden onset @<m>DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@weakness@@@ of bilateral upper and lower extremities.

citations.NLM: Tachamo N, Lohani S, Nazir S, Juliano N. Paralysis that easily reverses: a case of thyrotoxic periodic paralysis. BMJ Case Rep. 2017 Jan 30;2017():. PMID: 28137907
citations.BibTeX: @article{28137907, title={Paralysis that easily reverses: a case of thyrotoxic periodic paralysis.}, author={Tachamo N and Lohani S and Nazir S and Juliano N}, journal={BMJ Case Rep}, volume={2017}}

results.title: Metaproterenol intoxication in a dog.
results.text_hl: Administration of the beta blocking drugs @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ led to resolution of the clinical signs.

citations.NLM: Rush JE, Keene BW. Metaproterenol intoxication in a dog. J Am Vet Med Assoc. 1990 Nov 15;197(10):1351-3. PMID: 2266051
citations.BibTeX: @article{2266051, title={Metaproterenol intoxication in a dog.}, author={Rush JE and Keene BW}, journal={J Am Vet Med Assoc}, volume={197}, number={10}, pages={1351-3}}
